text.0: with all the succours that are yours o aśvins hither come to us.
text.1: wonderful borne on paths of gold drink ye the meath with soma juice.
text.2: come now ye aśvins on your car decked with a sunbright canopy.
text.3: bountiful with your golden forms sages with depth of intellect.
text.4: come hither from the nahusas come drawn by pure hymns from midair.
text.5: o aśvins drink the savoury juice shed in the kaṇvas sacrifice.
text.6: come to us hither from the heavens come from midair wellloved by us.
text.7: here kaṇvas son hath pressed for you the pleasant meath of soma juice.
text.8: come aśvins to give car to us to drink the soma aśvins come.
text.9: hail strengtheners of the praisesong speed onward ye heroes with your thoughts.
text.10: as heroes in the olden time the Ṛṣis called you to their aid.
text.11: so now o aśvins come to us come near to this mine eulogy.
text.12: even from the luminous sphere of heaven come to us ye who find the light.
text.13: carers for vatsa through our prayers and lauds o yewho hearour call.
text.14: do others more than we adore the aśvins with their hymns of praise.
text.15: the Ṛṣi vatsa kaṇvas son hath magnified you with his songs.
text.16: the holy singer with his hymns hath called you aśvins hitherward.
text.17: best vṛtraslayers free from stain as such bring us felicity.
text.18: what time ye lords of ample wealth the lady mounted on your car.
text.19: then o ye aśvins ye attained all wishes that your hearts desired.
text.20: come thence o aśvins on your car that hath a thousand ornaments.
text.21: vatsa the sage the sages son hath sung a song of sweets to you.
text.22: cheerers of many rich in goods discoverers of opulence.
text.23: the aśvins riders through the sky have welcomed this my song of praise.
text.24: o aśvins grant us all rich gifts wherewith no man mav interfere.
text.25: make us observe the stated times give us not over to reproach.
text.26: whether nāsatyas ye be nigh or whether ye be far away.
text.27: come thence o aśvins on your car that hath a thousand ornaments.
text.28: vatsa the Ṛṣi with his songs nāsatyas hath exalted you.
text.29: grant him rich food distilling oil graced with a thousand ornaments.
text.30: bestow on him o aśvins food that strengthens and that drops with oil.
text.31: on him who praises you for bliss and lords of bounty prays for wealth.
text.32: come to us ye who slay the foe lords of rich treasure to this hymn.
text.33: o heroes give us high renown and these good things of earth for help.
text.34: the priyamedhas have invoked you with all succours that are yours.
text.35: you aśvins lords of solemn rites with calls entreating you to come.
text.36: come to us aśvins ye who bring felicity auspicious ones.
text.37: to vatsa who with prayer and hymn lovers of song hath honoured you.
text.38: aid us o heroes for those hymns for which ye helped gosarya erst.
text.39: gave vaśa dasavraja aid and kaṇva and medhatithi.
text.40: and favoured trasadasyu ye heroes in spoildeciding fray.
text.41: for these o aśvins graciously assist us in acquiring strength.
text.42: o aśvins may pure hymns of ours and songs and praises honour you.
text.43: best slayers everywhere of foes as such we fondly yearn for you.
text.44: three places of the aśvins erst concealed are made apparent now.
text.45: both sages with the flight of law come hither unto those who live.
